column1:
Odeinoichus,"2018-03-21T15:15:31.607Z","Polybag set included with great book.","

Set #11914 DC Comics Super Heroes Build your Own Adventure parts: Whew, what a mouthful. Ahem, these are the included parts with the DK Book of the same name, it’s basically a larger Polybag style package with the necessary elements to construct the model included with the book. So, here’s the pros and cons of the entire set, like with all other polybag reviews.
Pros:

column2: Includes unique Super Hero Minifigure.
Features an excellently designed Lantern Construct space craft model.
Model is fun and easy to build. Also capable of being either space worthy or sea worthy according to the book.
Features stud launchers for play elements.

column1: Cons:

column2: The largest con of this is the actual price of the book to get it. In Canada the book is 32$ which is really ridiculous. Fortunately Costco prices reduce that to 50% of MSRP, so you’re only paying 15$ at Costco.
Bubble cockpit element is not green, which would have looked better honestly.
No Green Lantern ring accessory included.
Black printing for suit on legs is very awful looking.

column1: Overall opinion

As far as what you get here the model is really good it’s much more coherent than the construct Hal used in the Sinestro set and John Stewart looks great, so I’d definitely recommend picking up the book, but only if you can get it for a very good discount. I would even suggest going the Bricklink route if you’d prefer just to get the Minifigure, though the model is very solid and definitely should be included in any purchase decision as it works great and is very fun to play with.
